message_1: A company wants to encrypt a message with 30 characters using a transposition cipher. They decide to use a matrix with 6 columns. How many rows will the matrix have?
message_2:
To determine the number of rows needed for the matrix, you can divide the total number of characters (30) by the number of columns (6).

30 characters รท 6 columns = 5 rows

The matrix will have 5 rows.
